newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Aukland, HospiPlan deal revised down.
newsitem.headline: Aukland, HospiPlan deal revised down.

text.p: South African firm Aukland Investments Ltd said on Tuesday that the purchase price for its merger with HospiPlan Ltd has been revised down to 50 million rand.
The deal is to be settled by the issue of 12.5 million new Aukland shares at 400 cents each.

On October 23 Aukland said control of the firm would pass to HospiPlan following Aukland's acquisition of the entire share capital of and loan accounts against the private hospital group for 64 million rand.
The firm said then it would issue 16 million shares at 400 cents each.
But Aukland said on Tuesday that its consolidated after-tax profit for the year to February 29, 1996, was 3.62 million rand, as opposed to the previously reported 5.25 million rand.
It added that its net asset value had dropped to 22.72 million rand from 22.95 million rand.

Aukland started out having an interest in three rent producing shopping centres and office buildings. But from July 1, 1994, the firm acquired two businesses distributing hospital and surgical equipment and related products throughout Southern Africa.
